short_description: This function tests the hypothesis that thesample is drawn from the reference distribution.
long_description: This function tests the hypothesis that the sample is drawn from the reference distribution. It carries out up to four tests simultaneously: Anderson-Darling test, Kolmogorov-Smirnov test, Cramer-von Mises criterion, and Pearson's Chi-squared test. It gathers the intermediate results from the map function and computes the final statistics and p-values.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The table is the output DistnmatchMultipleinput
input_tables.description: The table is the output DistnmatchMultipleinput

argument_clauses.name: Top
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of the top matching distributions you want the function to output. Default value is 1
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of the top matching distributions you want the function to output. Default value is 1

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
